54d718f6cca21e66ee5a5e3bfd001912 (18:25): sounds like there could be some mapping added to make sure the file a bug feature converts it to a more appropriate value in bugzilla then?

e587f6146ebfbdefdc028c591643f220 (18:25): dbaron: I'd made a compiz version of your filter so that I could set arbitrary windows to look that way (faster than svg) - unfortunately that's no good for printing dark web pages either

8676f40c7c07987dc4274b0a98f6e07e (19:10): 00adb0702a98d60e91bee853adc4a0af, the "XXXkipp" suggests it's really old, though
00adb0702a98d60e91bee853adc4a0af (19:10): dbaron, yeah
8676f40c7c07987dc4274b0a98f6e07e (19:10): 00adb0702a98d60e91bee853adc4a0af, that comment could have been moved from elsewhere
00adb0702a98d60e91bee853adc4a0af (19:10): dbaron, I can't trace it back past roc's CVS commit that added that code
00adb0702a98d60e91bee853adc4a0af (19:10): dbaron, which was the "3.1" here: http://bonsai.mozilla.org/cvsblame.cgi?file=mozilla/layout/generic/nsTextFrameThebes.cpp&rev=3.1&root=/cvsroot
8676f40c7c07987dc4274b0a98f6e07e (19:11): http://bonsai.mozilla.org/cvsqueryform.cgi can be used to query the full commit rather than just the file... just query by date
3fe446bf43186a0a6ab70e26fba86a53 (19:11): but hen. Chump don' want no help, chump don't GET da' help!
8676f40c7c07987dc4274b0a98f6e07e (19:11): 00adb0702a98d60e91bee853adc4a0af, that 3.1 was just a split out the .h into its own file, I think

00adb0702a98d60e91bee853adc4a0af (19:11): dbaron, I did that, which gives http://bonsai.mozilla.org/cvsquery.cgi?treeid=default&module=all&branch=HEAD&branchtype=match&dir=&file=&filetype=match&who=&whotype=match&sortby=Date&hours=2&date=explicit&mindate=2007-01-16+12%3A40&maxdate=2007-01-16+12%3A55&cvsroot=%2Fcvsroot  , but the "Show me all the diffs" there doesn't show where the code came from
00adb0702a98d60e91bee853adc4a0af (19:11): dbaron, ah, interesting
8676f40c7c07987dc4274b0a98f6e07e (19:12): 00adb0702a98d60e91bee853adc4a0af, oh, it was probably copied from nsTextFrame.cpp
8676f40c7c07987dc4274b0a98f6e07e (19:12): 00adb0702a98d60e91bee853adc4a0af, which may not have been touched in that commit
3fe446bf43186a0a6ab70e26fba86a53 (19:12): (Barbara BillinGsley, Airplane 1980)
8676f40c7c07987dc4274b0a98f6e07e (19:12): 00adb0702a98d60e91bee853adc4a0af, but the comment makes it seem unlikely to lead to anything useful

8676f40c7c07987dc4274b0a98f6e07e (19:13): 00adb0702a98d60e91bee853adc4a0af, if you have some reason to change it, you can work out what code would be affected if you change it, and whether that code needs adjusting

00adb0702a98d60e91bee853adc4a0af (19:15): dbaron, ok.  my motivation is that the flexbox spec says to wrap anonymous blocks around non-replaced inline content, which includes basic text strings (per examples in the spec)
00adb0702a98d60e91bee853adc4a0af (19:15): dbaron, and I was using IsFrameOfType(eReplaced) to check for replaced elements, but that ended up filtering out text
8676f40c7c07987dc4274b0a98f6e07e (19:15): 00adb0702a98d60e91bee853adc4a0af, alternatively, you could just check for text
8676f40c7c07987dc4274b0a98f6e07e (19:15): 00adb0702a98d60e91bee853adc4a0af, but maybe worth a quick skim of who else checks eReplaced
00adb0702a98d60e91bee853adc4a0af (19:15): dbaron, yeah, that's my current hackaround.  Ok

3fe446bf43186a0a6ab70e26fba86a53 (19:51): I was kind of hoping for getting the tree open today, but is not looking as promising as it was earlier.

3fe446bf43186a0a6ab70e26fba86a53 (19:54): I suppose, we could keep mozilla-central closed and open inbound very metered and manually look at logs because tbpl is not working, but that is a lot to expect people to do over Christmas holidays.
3fe446bf43186a0a6ab70e26fba86a53 (19:56): So, I think keeping things closed until tbpl is reporting correctly is rally the only choice here.

3fe446bf43186a0a6ab70e26fba86a53 (19:59): But the real issue here seems to be that the release engineering people have no real idea how tbpl works and the tbpl people really have no idea how the build system works.  So, I think if we fix those issues we have a good way to go forward.
